content.description: Climb a mossy water stain behind the seasonal waterfall. Hard moves on pockets to the finish.
content.location: Waterfall gully obvious at the top of the Boneyard.

content.description: Climb the right side of the mossy chute high left in the Boneyard. Close bolts protect a fall into the other wall of the chute, be ware the z-clip.
content.location: Right side of the mossy red chute at the top left of the Boneyard.

content.description: Climb the black arete for some technical 5.10 leading to a large rest above some underclings and liebacks.  Rest and head left above the big roof into steeper 5.9 jugs to the anchors.  Difficulty eases toward the chains but the pump is real.
content.location: Enter the Bone Yard and pass Stormy Weather (5.9) on your right.  The next route climbs the black arete between Stormy Weather and Goldhammer (5.11b).

content.description: Start on some chossy feet and pull past the first bolt into more solid rock. Various styles and fun climbing with a few cruxes build a pump to the anchors.
content.location: Second route from the long buttress that shapes the western side of the boneyard.

content.description: Powerful moves up a hard ladder of holds to an easier finish.

First route entering the Bonyard, just up the slab. Pull an apron on pockets and begin a stem through a flake. Don’t cheat left, it’s awkward and off route, follow the technical pocketed face to the anchors.
content.location: First route on the right wall when you enter the Boneyard.

content.description: Climb up the features in the arete on the left side of the mossy steep chute. A lower crux and an upper roof are the beef of the route.
content.location: Left side of the mossy chute uphill of the long pitches.

content.description: 70 feet of 5.10 following a seam to the anchor.
content.location: Just left of the Yougonnalikit waterfall before the mossy chute.

content.description: Short steep route on pockets and edges that climbs into and pulls the beige roof.
content.location: Climbs the roof to the left of the Timewave/Forbidden Time start.

content.description: Start by climbing the black arete bottom right in the Boneyard.  After pulling through the underclings and liebacks , continue directly up the steep pocketed face for three bolts of steeper 5.11 climbing finishing with a delicate clip at the anchors.
content.location: Right variation of Timewave.  Climb direct opposed to left into a steeper and more difficult finish.

content.description: This is a link of the bottom half of Belle of the ball and the top of thunderbolt. 1 bolt links these two good section and avoids some of the choss at the top of belle of the ball,
Follow the steep golden slab to a red streak and pull an overhang on some small pockets to the anchor.
content.location: Uphill of Thunderbolt before the Boneyard curves into a steep mossy gully.

content.description: Follow some excellent pockets up this long face to the anchor near the top of the cliff. Fudge a tricky mid route sequence and you’ll fight to clip the next bolt.
content.location: Far left lowest route in the Boneyard.

content.description: Alcove sits at the far west end of the crag and hosts a handful of sport routes from 5.9 to 5.11+.  The west wall of this alcove is home to a couple of the longer 5.11 climbs at the crag.
